I didn't have to read the manual in order to start taking great pictures.The pictures it takes are just amazingly good without one having to adjust a gazillion things.The  EXMOR backlit CMOS sensor is great. Night shots are amazing for a Digital Camera- CCD Sensors can't compare.The "Superior Auto" mode can create some magnificent pictures. SEE SAMPLE PICTURES- at the top of the product description.* Do note that CCD Sensor cameras will produce a more detailed (absolute pixel resolution) picture than Backlit CMOS Sensor cameras like the Sony DSC-WX9. However, CCD Sensor cameras can't approach the fast shutter speeds and low light performance of Backlit CMOS Sensor cameras.I have had this camera for several weeks now and absolutely love it. I looked at Nikon, Cannon, Olympus, Panasonic, Fuji cameras in this class too. The only comparable ones, for me, were a Nikon (CMOS) and a Panasonic (CCD). Feature for feature the Sony DSC-WX9 came out on top. The Panasonic 16MP CCD 8x Zoom DMC-F25 was cheaper at $112.00, and the Nikon CMOS 14MP 5x Zoom S3100 was more expensive at $170.00. Reliably, I kept coming back to the Sony, and User Reviews were a big reason. I also read lots of reviews on Photography websites and consistently the Sony won me over. Importantly, only the Sony has HD AVC 1080/60i video capabilities. The Nikon and Panasonic shoot in MOV 720/24p high definition. The Sony's HD AVC format is preferred as it is very easy to edit. MOV video files are notoriously difficult to work with. Consequently, the Sony clearly stood out as the best value for me.I bought this Sony DSC-WX9 to be able to shoot extremely important/good pictures of my dog Faith who has advanced liver disease. This camera has delivered better than I could have ever imagined! We have been going out to the park behind my house almost daily to shoot pictures of her and myself ever since I got the DSC-WX9. I have shot up to 200+ photos at a time and have yet to "use up" the battery. I am pleased to report that we have amassed a huge quantity of excellent pictures. I view the photos on my 47 inch 1080p desktop monitor and edit them with ACD See Pro 5 and Adobe CS6. Needless to say I have a ton of printing left to do! Prints- so far- as large as 11 x 14 inches look "Professional"; seriously, they're that good!In summary, this is the best camera decision/purchase I have ever made. The Sony DSC-WX9 is SO MUCH CAMERA in such a small package. It is small enough to always have it with you. Moreover, excellent pictures are essentially assured and virtually dummy proof; especially when you use features like "Superior Auto". I'm glad I'm not lugging around a monster DSLR- no need!I FOUND THE PERFECT CASE FOR THE DSC-WX9 (it fits snug; is small; and allows quick access):9098302 Body Glove Clutch Black Universal Case - RetailFinally, take a look at some of the sample images at the top of the "product description". I suspect you will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent with some drawbacks!!!
Reviews.Author: Kengraghu
Reviews.Content: Another Excellent Digital Camera from Sony.Would like to rate it at 5 Stars, but still thinking should I make it 5 stars or keep it at 4 stars.Has everything, except for 2 drawbacks. Hence 4 star, but still thought it was good.Pros:Sleek and light weight. Small buttons, but that is how the camera can be made sleek.Good Clarity.Excellent HD Video recording, thinking now, did I need a Camcorder, since I purchased both Camcorder and Camera, both are Sony.Cons:No Touch.Battery.  Took 25 photos and did a 4 Min recording, battery dropped to 75%, so thinking it needs a spare battery for day long shots on trips. Need to test total number of photos. But Yes Battery is non-satisfactory.Need to charge Battery with the camera, so need to purchase an extra portable charger, since you cannot charge two batteries at the same time.Time to write to disc is bit slow, so you need to wait 20-30 Secs till you take the next snap.  I have a Sandisk Extreme class 10 memory card).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: bebe
Reviews.Content: The picture and video quality is amazing. Great HD viewing. Pictures look professional and all I have to do is hit the button! I am also amazed at how quickly the picture is snapped compared to all of the other cameras I have had. This camera is a bargain for the price. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Sony CyberShot DSC-WX9
Reviews.Author: Birat
Reviews.Content: This camera is for people who don't want to invest their brain & time in understanding DSLR but want more or less the same quality picture.Plus point:CMOS sensor are well known to capture more picture information. hence picture is good in low light, more color depth, blazing fast.DSLR feature:background de-focus, bigger aperture, image stabilization (improved), etcFew feature i liked:Sweep panorama (3D), Full HD recording, 3D (but need a 3D TV to view), price :)minus point:buttons are small but not tough to handle, zoom button is awkwardly placed..Still i'm exploring new feature :)Please note i didn't talk about MP.. its not my priority :)

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara
Reviews.Author: cruz
Reviews.Content: Muy buena la cámara en todos sus aspectos, me llego puntual, lastima que no viene con la memoria incluida, pero de resto me pareció muy buena mi inversión

Reviews.Title: Great all round camera
Reviews.Author: Infiniti Lover
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer but I love taking lots of pictures of our vacations and capturing special moments all the time! I wanted a good camera that would also do video that would suffice for us.This is it! I am obsessive and read hundreds and hundreds of reviews like this before I bought this camera. I read articles in photography magazines too. I took months to decide on a new camera before making the choice to buy another Sony! But this camera had what I wanted and needed at a price that I could live with.I have owned it for a month and taken it on two long trips.I am still learning how to use all the features on it and there are plenty!! Right now I am shooting videos with ease and most or all of my photos have been taken on Intelligent Mode,where the camera choses all the settings.I am amazed at how the icons flash on which setting it has chosen for certain times of day and modes of light. I am thrilled with it so far!!It is light and compact and easy to handle.I have only one complaint about it and that is the controls are so small that at times it is difficult to use properly? I would still buy this same camera again though! All of the tiny digital cameras have this same issue. I did purchase an accessories kit on Amazon that included an extra battery,another charger that also works in the car,a case,a tiny tripod,a USB unit for downloading on all computers and a 18G memory card! Got all of that for what just the extra battery was going to cost me in our local store!! I can pretty much shoot video and photos for as long as I want where ever I want now!!Short of being a professional photographer I think that this is a perfect camera for pretty much anyone!! You will love it and the red color makes it fun too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. No complaints. Great to have both a 16MP digital camera and a hi-def video camera in such a small package. Liked it so much that I ordered another one just like it for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Best One Yet
Reviews.Author: crimsonBOY
Reviews.Content: I have owned many P&S; cameras before and I can finally say I have found the right one for my needs. Very clear image quality, video quality and size is perfect

Reviews.Title: good for what it is.
Reviews.Author: spr "spr"
Reviews.Content: Takes good photos and has good white balance. Mechanical buttons and dials are preferable to a badly implemented touch screen.  Light, small and slim enough to fit in your pocket at 0.8". Starts up quickly, and can take 10 frapes per second if needed. Sweep panorama and assorted 'scene' selections are helpful.  5x zoom is OK on a camera this tiny. Takes nice shots from limited macro to portrait to landscape and full HD video. Moderate low-light performance - but better than you might expect.It is not a top line camera of course - but performs very well copmpared to cameras in the $190 price range and had 16 megapixels so you can crop a little.  If you are a pixel-peeper, look elsewhere.  For the casual shooter - one that wants something portable and convenient - this is not a bad choice and will get you quality enlargements if needed.  Under good conditions - you can get very nice images indeed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: AWhitey
Reviews.Content: The last time I bought a camera was in 2006 (Sony DSC-W30) so I decided it was about time to get a new one. After looking around at a few different cameras, I settled on this one. After taking over 700 pictures with it (within 2 weeks), I can safely say that this camera does everything I could have possibly wanted it to do and more. The biggest highlights for me are the excellent low light performance (I hate using flash because I feel it ruins just about anything buy a portrait), all around great image quality (I would say almost every picture looks good, and those taken in good lighting look spectacular), panoramic mode (you really don't realize how neat this feature is till you try it), and a beautiful display. The 3D feature is also pretty cool to have, but I don't have anything to view those pictures on as of yet (I really wish I could see what they look like). All of my friends are thoroughly impressed by the pictures I take with this, and a few of them own DSLRs (of course the pictures taken on the wx9 aren't as good as a DSLR, but they're amazing for a point and shoot).The only major downside to this camera is battery life. You almost need to buy a spare battery if you plan on having it last the whole day, and if you take any videos on the highest quality those two may not even get you all the way there (The HD video destroys battery life, although the quality is excellent). Aside from that, the only minor frustrations I've run into are that the high resolution panoramic mode is difficult to use (there's a regular mode and a high resolution mode, and while the former works perfectly, the later is really difficult to take pictures on without noticing where the individual photos were merged; although when you do succeed, it looks beautiful), and that it can't really focus on small objects that are far away when you zoom in (though that seems to be a problem with most point and shoots I've tried.I would not hesitate to say that this is one of the best point and shoot cameras you can buy. The only one that's probably better is the Sony dsc-hx9v, but it costs $130 more than the wx9, so for the price this camera really can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Sony Compact camera
Reviews.Author: Lo
Reviews.Content: This is a great pocket camera. The pictures are every  bit as fine as the large Cybershot. It is compact and light weight. A little jewel.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Takes pictures almost as good as my DSLR. This was the camera I used on my last trip. Takes. Great indoor picture in low light even without a flash. The panorama feature is great!!!! The burst shoot with 10 shots is outstanding.Would highly recommend to anyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Over all, a very nice camera!
Reviews.Author: adamsplanet
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. It has some really nice features. I LOVE the panorama feature. the picture quality is really good too, not DSLR quality, but close. pretty easy to use. It is a little slow when it comes to processing the images, but then again, that could just be my SD card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Neustocks
Reviews.Content: I'll make this brief, since this camera is two generations old (the WX-9 was succeeded by the WX-50; the WX-50 was succeeded by the WX-80).  I purchased mine used for $40ish dollars after shipping.  I also own a WX-50, which I purchased for $130ish several months ago.  The WX-9 is every bit as good as the WX-50.  The pictures come out very clear and detailed, the option to charge the battery in the camera is a great bonus, and the Mini-HDMI connector is useful to have.On the downside however, when using Superior Auto mode, the picture processing takes a couple of seconds or so before you can view the picture.  This is noticeably slower than the WX-50.  This is not a big issue for me and what I use the camera for, but it could be for you.  If you are trying to decide between the two cameras, and the prices are similar or identical, I would lean toward the newer model for this reason.  That and the WX-9 still uses the custom USB connector, while the WX-50 uses a standard micro-USB connector for charging and data transfer.The optics and image sensor seem exactly the same, and the quality of the pictures taken are virtually indistinguishable, so if you can get a bargain on a WX-9, go for it.  I doubt you will regret the decision.

Reviews.Title: too long snaptime
Reviews.Author: busy father
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera if you are into staged photo's or portrait, however if you want to take a quick action snapshot of kids on the run this is not the camera for you.  Even in Easy Mode this camera take too long to snap the picture and with kids you will miss a perfect moment.  I have this camera for two years and now that my daughter start running around more I need an other camera.

Reviews.Title: Died in 6 months SONY would not repair!!
Reviews.Author: J. Schiller "Doctor J 10011"
Reviews.Content: I have owned over 40 cameras in my life. I use a camera at work as a plastic surgeon and for travel and family photos. This camera died in 6 months after normal use. Sony technicians said there is "corrosion" and voided the warranty. No appeal possible. I am shocked that with Sony losing 2 billion dollars last year they will not support their product which died prematurely. Buy a Canon!

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera with a lot to offer.
Reviews.Author: Ticklebunny1
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last summer after spending over a week looking at many different cameras. I used to have a few Kodak cameras (did not like them at all since it would have poor battery/image quality) and I own several Sony Electronics so I decided that I would get this camera instead, based on reviews/previous Sony Quality and I was greatly impressed!!It pretty much is point and shoot, and it has smile detection/blink detection software in it which helps taking pictures when a smile is detected, or if someone blinks it lets you know. My main thing about the camera which I like is it works amazing in low light conditions! As I said it is point and shoot, and it can take pictures just as you see it without having to use flash. The pictures sometimes look 'painted' not sure why, or kind of fake but I think it just has to do with the quality of the camera and once you print the pictures they look like a normal picture.Overall I think this is a great camera, well worth the price and I have not run into any problems with it. The battery lasts a good while and the picture quality stays constant. I did not have to mess with the settings at all and normally use Superior Auto on all my pictures and it does a good job with making the images come out good. The Sony PMB software provided makes uploading pictures to Facebook/emailing pictures quick and simple.

Reviews.Title: WX9
Reviews.Author: Buyer
Reviews.Content: After doing a very thorough research about cameras and digital photography, i purchased this camera. If you are the kinda person that is not into constantly adjusting camera settings and just need a camera that takes very nice pictures, this camera is for you. It is very easy to use and takes exceptional pictures even in darker settings. It took me 30 mins to figure this entire camera out. Basically you leave it at the best auto setting and it will keep taking good quality images. Panorama feature is amazing. Looks and feels great and is a very good size for pocket. Video quality is 1080i HD with audio. I would recommend buying the largest memory card, extended extra battery for longer use, hdmi cable and nice bag to keep everything organized. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSCWX9/BBDL 16.2 MP CMOS Sensor with 5 x Optical Zoom Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: KushKal
Reviews.Content: I had recently purchased the Sony DSCWX9/BBDL 16.2 MP CMOS Sensor with 5 x Optical Zoom Digital Camera for my parents who are very bad with technology. However my parents were quick learners and I though this Camera would be the best option.Pros._________________________________________________-One of the reasons was that the Sleek Black look of the Sony Cyber Shot gave the camera a very professional look which got my parents excited.-The camera was smaller than I had imagined, was able to fit into most pockets.-5X Digital Zoom was nothing to brag about but the distance sure is nice to have.-16.2 Mega Pixels!! I haven't found any camera with a resolution so precise, my parents were amazed by the clarity.-1080 high definition video was overkill when I took a 5 minute video of my parents, They were astounded by the clarity of the video and were fixated on the video capability.-My parents have always been fans of Sony, however this time the price was too arguably the best for a camera of this high quality resolution.Cons____________________________________________________-There were some cons such as the half metallic/plastic covering of the Cyber shot camera which I though would easily break, since my friend broke his on the 4Th day of trying it and ~tak tak~ the lens stopped working (good thing he has a 1 year warranty).-The battery is really low capacity and needs charging constantly after use. ( I repeatedly had to remind my parents on the phone). Until i Bought them a spare battery in which they could keep switching in case they forgot. (extra battery is $12 at amazon, I had purchased it for 30 at Best buy).*The second con is that the screen is susceptible/prone to smudges w/o a screen protector say goodbye to that high resolution screen. My parents told me the 3rd day that the screen went black and I didn't know the reason ( I am very computer Savvy). In which i found that I had received a defective Sony Cyber shot. Which had lost some trust with Sony and their quality, and so we returned/re-ordered it. No problems as of yet.___________________________________________________+There are many options on this camera for those who love to options such as-1080i movie-Panorama-3D picture- and plenty of Smarty Pic designs such as auto adjust for any type of images such as scenery, close of head shots, or even food which makes you hungry for more.All in All I would recommend this product who are good with tech savvy or able to learn quickly, And make sure its not defective or it will dishearten you from purchasing another camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty COOL!!!
Reviews.Author: G. N. Castillo "GNC"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. Great pictures. Haven't used the video yet. The options are endless. I love the smile setting and multiple shots setting. Small and light perfect to fit in your purse. I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Far beyond Value for Money
Reviews.Author: APS
Reviews.Content: This cam was a surprise. I own a NIKON SLR and found the images taken by this cam extremely crisp. This is a compact and small camera. The functions  and panel is easy to use, shortcut to panorama mode is excellent.This cam come with lot of auto setting which allows novice to click great pics.  I found its panorama feature too good and easy to use. However at low light it was difficult to focus, but that make sense. At 139$ it is a stealer.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: bigPhil44
Reviews.Content: Like many here, I read a lot of reviews before buying the Sony DSC-WX9 Cyber Shot camera. Was looking at Canon's 300 ELPH model as well. From what I gathered, the 300 ELPH had a lot of problems with the lenses-especially, if they were made in China. I wanted  badly to buy another Canon because I had owned the A570 IS 7.1 MP camera before. Really liked it because it took great pictures. However, it uses AA batteries and was quite bulky to carry around. The 300 ELPH looked like a real winner until I did more research and found out about the lens problems. While reading a review, a reviewer mentioned he had taken the Canon 300 ELPH back and gotten a Sony DSC-WX9. I found that review to be quite helpful. Upon my own further research, I discovered that the WX9 did not have the dreaded lens problems like the 300 ELPH has. But, there were concerns about battery life AND that the controls were too small. That being said, I went to my local BB and seen for myself what the WX9 had to offer me. It is true that the WX9 is very compact but fit well in my hands. Really had no way to test the battery life. So, I went ahead and made my purchase. As a back up plan, I decided to buy a battery charger and (2) extra batteries.Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Sony NP-BN1, Cyber-shot DSC-T99, DSC-T110, DSC-TX5, DSC-TX7, DSC-TX9, DSC-TX10, DSC-TX100V, DSC-W310, DSC-W320, DSC-W330, DSC-W350, DSC-W360, DSC-W380, DSC-W390, DSC-W510, DSC-W515PS, DSC-W520, DSC-W530, DSC-W550... However, I recently took over 100 indoor shots at a friends birthday party with the flash on auto mode and the camera never once went dead. I did NOT record any video as I bought the WX9 to mainly shoot pictures. I must say, that I am very glad that I did. Yes, the camera is very compact and the controls are small. Over time, I have managed to get use to them. All it takes is a little practice. Small controls were not that big of a deal to ME. Now for others, it could be. In fact, I really like the compactness of the WX9. Most of the pictures I took at the birthday party were very good. Keep in mind, I am still learning how to use the WX9. I am truly an amateur when it comes to picture taking. However, the WX9 makes it easy to do. So far so good. I do think that the WX9 pushes the reds a bit too much, but it is not something that blows the deal so to speak. The color is very good in most of the pics I have taken so far. By that I mean they look natural. Even in low light, the pictures look amazing with great detail. The menu options are laid out very logically. All in all, I love this camera. I highly recommend it. Especially, for amateurs like me. What are you waiting for-just buy it! You will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: Great  camera
Reviews.Author: Sharrose
Reviews.Content: I really love my camera.I gave it a 4 stars only because the wheel is a little difficult to work with. I am still learning this camera there is more to it than just point and shoot. settings. I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Good specs and price but SLOW operation
Reviews.Author: J.Murphy
Reviews.Content: This camera has great specs and price but has a really slow processor.  It needs maybe 2 seconds between photos and takes 3 seconds to start recording video.  WIth this lag I often missed the action I was trying to record.  Also its low-light photography was poor - nothing compared to a Canon.  I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Moonie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and all of it's features. I'm not good with cameras at all and have found this easy to use (never have opened manual) and I'm able to capture wonderful pictures. I especially love the gourmet and panaramic modes. The gourmet mode although for food takes very detailed photos. I got some beautiful Christmas tree photos using that mode. Oh and the skin feature is so cool! It automatically clears people's complexions :)It's true test will be Disney World fireworks which I always have struggled getting perfect shots with other cameras in the past. I have a feeling this one will get me some good shots.My only complaint would be I wish the software allowed for more editing than what it does which is hardly anything.

Reviews.Title: one of the best Point and Shoot,
Reviews.Author: (K.J.)
Reviews.Content: used it while traveling and to take short videos.This camera has exceeded my expectations, ALL what I need and even more !Quick point and shoot timeGreat shots at low-lightHigh quality videoEasy to usepanoramic shotsHDMI,,, :)

Reviews.Title: Great quality pics and video but a couple real annoying things
Reviews.Author: HD Fan
Reviews.Content: Video quality and pics are excellent. One issue you may run into is if you are running Windows 7, you need to install a separate audio codec when playing avchd videos using WMP or else the audio just does this very loud stutter. It plays fine using some player that comes with the camera but I prefer WMP. Installed the codec from here: ac3filterdotnet and now it works fine. That being said there's a couple other audio issues. 1. The zoom motor is quite loud and is caught on video. I guess I can live with it but could definitely do w/o seeing that other cameras and camcorders find a way to mute it or minimize the noise. 2. For some reason there is this stupid electronic chirping sound when taking video in quiet surroundings. Here is an example: [...]- Listen from about 5 seconds into the video and on. This is not my video so seems to affect this model, not sure if it's present in all but at least there are a few out there. I've seen a few samples on youtube from different owners and same weird sound. I don't see any firmware updates to address this and I called Sony and they are not aware of this issue and were not able to fix it. Only way is by sending it in which I hate to do because means I have to be w/o it for maybe a month. If it didn't have this issue, definitely higher rating, just seems like a firmware update could fix it, if so, hopefully soon. Based on this I can't recommend this camera. I checked samples of the next level up the WX10, this issues doesn't seem to be present. Very disappointed that Sony allowed this to slip, I've never seen anything like this even on a lesser brand. I haven't used it long enough to judge battery life but I always carry 2 for any digital imaging device I have anyways. I may have to send it in, I convinced Sony to send me a pre-paid label to send it in. I told them I shouldn't have to pay for their mistake so we'll see.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: WVU student
Reviews.Content: Picked up this camera to use while traveling and to take short videos.This camera has exceeded my expectations, here's a list of why I love this cameraQuick point and shoot timeGreat shots at low-lightHigh quality video for such a small deviceWide angle lensEasy to use panoramic shotsHDMI hookupOverall for the $$$ a great little camera

Reviews.Title: Very Great For Price!
Reviews.Author: Jacob Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSC-WX9 is by far one of the best cameras ive owned, in both Video Production Quality, and Picture Quality. the best feature i love is the choice to film in AVC-HD or MP4 for better uploading to websites, i can not really see the 3D pics because i do not have a 3D television At the moment. but i will when i get the chance. the only bad side, is the Battery life, it is okay for what it is, but if your on vacation, make sure to have the USB cord and Adapter handy, especially when recording alot of videos. Aside from that, it was the best $150 i spent :)!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera with clear 1080p video recording
Reviews.Author: Danny Yu
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I bought this for about $180 back in August of this year, and I still think that is a great price. Solid (but not perfect) picture taking, very clear full HD (1900 x 1080p) video recording, easy panoramic shooting, and stylish and robust design are among my favorite features of this camera.The Good:- Many picture modes like background defocus (my favorite), soft snap, landscape, and twilight.- I like the burst mode. You can capture either 2 shots per second, or up to 10 shots per second. In viewing mode, you can twist the camera left and right to "animate" what you just captured. Neat little feature.- The design is generally good, It's easy to change from picture, video, or panoramic mode. The back of the camera has a glossy finish and the screen is big and looks beautiful when lit.- Video recording is amazing. I've been able to capture very clear videos. I've used this camera to film in court and every time the video quality is top notch. However, note that for the highest resolution, you can only burn those video to Blu ray.- Very easy to mount on a tripod. I've used this camera many times with my Sunpak 620-520D 52-Inch Lightweight Tripod- The battery/memory compartment is easy to open and has a lock.The not so good, but are tolerable:- The wheel for the picture modes isn't as user friendly. Essentially, you spin it with your thumb, but it's easy to accidentally press down.  It can be difficult to switch between modes, but it just takes a little getting used to.- At the highest zoom (5x),I notice some deterioration of picture quality. It's still good, but the change of picture quality is noticeable.Overall, a solid point and shoot camera that has good picture and video capture quality. For the features and performance, the price is unbeatable.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Cannot Express how Much I LOVE this Camera.
Reviews.Author: Jenn P "Jenn P"
Reviews.Content: This is my First Sony Camera.  6 months ago I purchased the Panasonic Lumix ZS10 after much research.  I was not satisfied with the indoor shots this past thanksgiving so I started researching digital cameras again.  I need a fairly simple camera, but looking for clarity and sharpness in my photos.  In 2011 this can't be hard can it?  I first tried the Canon Powershot Elf 100HS, which got rave reviews.  Well I'm returning that!  I got a great buy on this Sony Cybershot after reading some good reviews, some not.  OMG my pics are stunning, FINALLY!  One outing I learned how to creat panoramic photos and got some crystal clear shots of my dogs... I posted two pics above of the Lake and of my Weiner dog inside.  I am SOO happy and pleased I found this camera for the results of the photos alone.  It is pretty easy to use, and I look forward to learning about it.  The 3 inch display is gorgeous.  Wish I could have gotten a pink camera, but it only comes in 3 colors.  Anyone on the fence, try this SONY!  This is a lot of camera for the price. I have not tried the video, but the picture quality is outstanding. LOVE!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Great Price
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.  Camera takes very sharp crisp pictures and the videos are actually very clear.  Is surpising how well the videos look for being such a small camera.  I like it alot.  It is rechargeable so you wont be needing to waste money on batteries.  If you are considering buying this product, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Best sony Cyber-Shot made By far
Reviews.Author: Anson A. Cray Jr. "Kid Nintendo"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves her new camera. The pictures are so clear and the features make it so easy to just point and shoot without having to do adjusting at all.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: tortoise_jockey
Reviews.Content: This camera is small enough to carry in your pocket, and takes GREAT pictures. I'm talking EXCELLENT pictures. I would totally buy this camera again. I have enjoyed it SO much so far!!

Reviews.Title: Good pocket camera, excellent in low light video mode
Reviews.Author: rich_w
Reviews.Content: I love a camera that offers full aperture and shutter control.  This is not that kind of camera.  In spite of that, the incredible XMOR R sensor gets the job done in a no-brainer kind of way.  Great for vacationing, b'day parties and indoor low light settings where flash can not be used.  There are pre-programmed modes that you must experiment with in order to take full advantage of what this pocket camera has to offer.There is the easy mode... I set that for anyone using the camera who just wants to take a picture and doesn't want the hassles.  Amazingly, in 90% of situations it gets the job done with exceptional results.Hey, this is a pocket camera.  Don't expect the lens to perform magic... but the electronics are powerful.  Compared to my Sony DSC F717, the better glass on the 717 5 megapixel camera can't be replaced with 14 megapixel pocket thing.  Each is in its own class.  I enjoy owning both!I do recommend this camera for anyone looking for a portable pocket, easy to use unit.  The video is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Phang
Reviews.Content: see, this camera has everything you want. swipe panoramic is the best feature i ever used, i mean all you have to do is just swipe.and another thing, this camera takes quality picture.the adjustment in color intensity is very good, the color on every picture looks balanced and heavy.if you finding a 'dslr like' camera and you don't want to carry heavy stuffs with you, this is your best choiceyou will never regret for what u paid.p/s : this camera is not suitable for waterproof bag to go underwater, juz bcuz the hardware itself is very sensitive to water, water vapor or little amount of water will cause the camera to malfunction for a while or even permanently.

Reviews.Title: minor zoom issue
Reviews.Author: chaix
Reviews.Content: I have point and shoots as well as DSLR.  For DSLR I normally use Canon and found that for point and shoot Sony is better specially because the last longer.  Great camera, great picture quality, great video HD shooting in 720/30p mode.  The only drawbacks is a strange vibration on the zoom when you are using it for video shooting, it happens when you are zooming away at the very end, and that you can only charge the battery inside the camera (tried charging it on older Sony charger and doesn't work).

Reviews.Title: SO MAD
Reviews.Author: mabelyn07
Reviews.Content: UGH!! From my knowledge, this is a brand new camera, I've only had it for a couple of months and it has stopped working for no reason! I never take it out in bad weather and I have yet to even drop it, but it won't work. The shutter is always getting stuck and now everytime I turn it on it tells me to turn it off and back on again, and after doing so it just repeats the message. I am so mad!!! I wish there was something I could do, I LOVED this camera :<

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: pj'smom
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  It's super fast, and catches my kids mid action with very little blur. I find it easy to quickly change settings and user friendly, and a nice small size--I toss it in the diaper bag so it's always with me,  On low light w/o flash, the images can be grainy, but they are in focus.  In other settings, the pictures are beautiful.  I love the HD video as well, it's nice that you can zoom in and out while shooting movies--and is compatible with imovie.  .  All in all  a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera especially for panoramic use.
Reviews.Author: Tnsgirl
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera specifically for panoramic view. It works really great. The other features are also good. Picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: 4.5 stars for the price!
Reviews.Author: S. Chen
Reviews.Content: As a college student, this camera does everything I need it to do. Although I wouldn't consider myself even an amateur photographer, I do prize sharp pictures and image quality (the Lumix LX5 is my ideal camera but unfortunately is outside my price range). I travel frequently, so I needed a camera that takes good outdoor photos while also able to take good pictures of myself and friends - including in low light. I did a fair bit of research trying to find a camera within my budget (under $200) and wasn't even planning to look at the Sony Cybershot line (my previous Cybershot frustrated me to no end) until I noticed the f/2.6 on this camera!Likes:The outdoor/nature photos are superb. (I'll upload a couple.) Indoor in most lighting is great. Panorama is a really neat function. The food scene!Dislikes:Low light photos...are slacking a bit. But maybe I just have yet to figure out the right settings (iAuto does not do a good job.)I have noticed that the WX9 sometimes does not focus on faces in the iAuto mode. there is not a portrait scene to correct this mistake, either.It takes a few seconds for the camera to start recording video after hitting the record button.The scene selection mode is not as extensive as my previous Lumix camera.I've only had the camera for about a month, but so far, I'm impressed, and I've even managed to convert one of my friends to a Cybershot user!

Reviews.Title: excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: chaka kahn "iheartkennywinker"
Reviews.Content: I researched this thoroughly because I consider this a major purchase. This camera is extremely easy to use and takes incredible pics and video. I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera, but, died in a week!
Reviews.Author: N. Singh
Reviews.Content: This is a awesome little powerhouse, while it worked, the pictures were amazing . I used it for a week and then one fine day, i could not close the shutter and everything just died! I will have to praise Amazon.com for taking the product back without any hassle and refunding me my money. I got another one!!!:0)

Reviews.Title: Very good camera, only problem the battery ends very quickly when filming... max 25min.
Reviews.Author: zuze
Reviews.Content: Very good camera - light weight, small. good picture and video quality. only problem the batterie uses very quickly when filming - tops 25min..

Reviews.Title: A few things to fix
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I purchased the WX9 in June 2011. Overall I like the camera. 16mp pics are great-and in such a small package! It takes nice pics and I LOVE the panaramic feature. The Carl Zeiss lens is good glass. The little camera shot 1080i video, great quality. It comes with many shooting modes. Picture quality is good, the viewfinder is gorgeous. Shoots o.k. in low light.  There are a couple of things I would change if I were a camera engineer at Sony. Some of the buttons are recessed which makes pressing them difficult-including the on/off switch. The file/storage button is the same, most others have elevated surfaces. Battery life is not great-the large LCD screen consumes power. A power-saving screen might extend battery life. I can't download my videos onto my destop computer (a PC) or my daughter's MAC. It would be nice if Sony created the video in a more universal format-MP4 or Quicktime maybe. Sony included some proprietary software to dowload onto the computer for picture storage-I've removed mine. You can open the picture files by just waiting for the Microsoft prompt. Store them on your hard drive, thumb drive, or CD/DVD.Evidently Sony feels they can afford to include an instuction manual with the camera-yes you get a basic manual-but a full one would be nice-c'mon people it's just paper!Would I buy this camera again? Tough question, might have to look at the newer Sony's and see if they corrected any of the flaws.

Reviews.Title: It's good but not the best
Reviews.Author: Jose Pisani "Jose H"
Reviews.Content: It's a great cam, it has a lot of options but hasn't the main option, MACRO option. SONY always forgets something

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: hri
Reviews.Content: I think that is an excelent digital camera with a lot of functions and a very good video quality. The buttons are a bit unconfortable but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: It was ok
Reviews.Author: J. Durand
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I returned this camera after purchase. It was one of several cameras I purchased to evaluate prior to deciding on a replacement camera for work. The camera is compact and easy to hold and the screen is fantastic, with extremely high resolution. While this screen is nice it has so much resolution that your pictures actually look better on the camera then when looking at them on a computer monitor. The construction was solid but not solid enough for my taste.  It is mainly plastic and the front panel (a thin metal cap) was actually separating a little on the upper left corner right out of the box.  The pictures when viewed on a monitor did not satisfy me in terms of quality. There was a lot of noise suppression and the images lacked "real" detail to my eyes.  Contrast was very high by default(some people prefer this I do not).  The HD video was nice but I needed good pictures over HD video so it was not a factor for me.  Battery life seemed extremely short, with the battery losing all charge after less than 120 pictures of around the house testing. I also did not like the fact that you had to plug the battery charging cord into the camera itself and charge the battery in the camera. I prefer charging the battery in a wall charger since I often buy spare batteries for the cameras I use.Overall, I was not pleased with this camera and chose to return it. It may be perfectly fine for some but the combination of questionable build, less than stellar picture quality, and poor battery life did not appeal to me so back it went.  The camera chosen as it's replacement was a Canon Elph 300hs, which I believe to be a better unit than this one.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Alexandr Zastanceanu "Zealot"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th camera- It's a great device with many usefull functions, great picture quality and with a good SD card takes pictures with  verry low dellay before the next shot . Ignore reviews like - "don't buy - it brakes"  - it happens,  maybe hands are not straight.The camera  is a bit bigger than cannon elph 300 , but I think better , great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!!
Reviews.Author: Scooper
Reviews.Content: LOOVE this camera. Thank goodness a friend of mine recommended it. It has an amazing picture quality unlike any camera I've owned before. I'm an amateur photographer and take lots of photos. The battery life could be better, but I guess that's one of the downfalls with any newer camera.  It's easy to use and my photos barely need editing after I upload them. I wanted a camera that didn't give everyone red eye (my biggest pet peeve) and this camera does a fantastic job of it. There was only ONE picture so far with red eye, and I used the red eye corrector (as a built in setting on the camera) to fix it and it did a perfect job. Took the camera to NYC and it took amazing pictures everyone was impressed. I'm VERY happy with this camera so far!

Reviews.Title: Excelente por el precio...
Reviews.Author: ZenkyNET
Reviews.Content: Anduve buscando por un tiempo una camara barata y con algunas interesantes opciones, al fin la encontre.No es perfecta pero tiene todo lo que andaba buscando.Google Translate:I have been looking for a time a cheap camera with some interesting options, finally found it.It is not perfect but it has everything I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA UNLESS YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN YOU NEVER DROP IT, EVEN FROM A LOW HEIGHT.
Reviews.Author: Pano
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative review but I cannot tell you how dissatisfied I am with the product design of this camera and the Sony company. Its no wonder they are losing market share like crazy in consumer electronics.I own two perfectly worthless DX9 cameras because Sony will not own up to design defects in the camera.If this camera hits the ground from anywhere above six inches, the LCD screen will crack internally (the glass will be fine) making the camera worthless and SONY WILL NOT REMEDY ANY PHYSICAL DAMAGE REGARDLESS OF THE FACT THAT POOR DESIGN ENABLES THIS.I have owned Nikons and Canon cameras for years and I bought two of these cameras. Boy what a mistake. I even own a Nikon FM from 1976 that is in perfect working order -- that is how careful I am with cameras!!!The first DX9 one I bought was based on a food reviewer saying that it does a great job with food shots. It was reasonably-enough priced and bought it from Amazon and started using it.Until I dropped it from a chair (less than 2 foot drop) onto a carpet. The camera was off at the time and it looked fine because the LCD glass did not crack.But as soon as I turned it on, it was obvious that the internal glass had cracked rendering the camera useless.I assumed that this was a fluke, having numerous cameras and Iphones (4 in my house) with never a screen breaking or rendering the phone or camera inoperable.So, I bought another one and within two weeks, this one fell out of my pocket, and again, no damage on the outside, but a useless camera because of a cracked LCD screen.The worst has been Sony. Two cameras in less than 30 days and Sony refuses to repair either one of the cameras.POOR DESIGNBecause the screen goes all the way to 3 edges of the camera, any impact to any of those 3 edges will result in the LCD screen cracking internally.Any other well made product has a rim protecting the LCD edges from collecting direct impact.VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICESony will not warranty any damage to the camera. They will not provide discount repairs. They will not swap out the camera. So whatever you do, buy another camera.I will never buy another Sony product again.The design is poor. Sony's attitude is appalling and cameras are a commodity so BUY ANY CAMERA BUT THIS ONE.

It seems that, even if the camera has been off for days after charging, something drains it - I'd charge it, let it sit between uses, then when I had to go use it again, it would be dead! Reviews.Content: This camera takes a little practice to get used to, but once you master it, it's a joy to use. Takes amazing pictures and very good HD videos. The only flaw is the 5X zoom. Would be nice to have an 8x or better, but that's nitpicking. Excellent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: A decent camera
Reviews.Author: Aakash Verma
Reviews.Content: Finding a good camera that is not expensive is hard.  The Sony Cybershot DSC-WX9 is a great camera to go with for the money.  Why?  Any camera can take a picture of something not moving in bright light.  The true test of a camera is where it's being pushed to its limits:  low light and when something is moving.  This is because light is information to a camera.  Cameras generally have three ways to deal with this, for motion it's to take a quicker picture.  For low light the camera makes its iris through the lens of the camera larger (this is called an aperture).  Finally in general is sensor size:  the larger the sensor, the more light it picks up.So why is this important?  If your camera cannot pull these situations off, you are left with dark pictures or really blurry pictures.  Lots of cameras have things like a big display and image stabilization, so what makes the Sony different?For motion, the camera optimizes shots with superior auto mode.  This function actually takes more time to take a picture but automatically optimizes scenes.  If you don't know how to work your camera's settings and just to press that shutter to get a picture, this will help you take better photos.For low light, there is the iris (aperture) and the sensor.  The sensor is on the high side of compact cameras and the aperture is fairly large (sensor is 1/2.3 and the largest aperture is 2.6)The only thing that I would add onto this camera is more than a 5x zoom.  All in all, the DSC-WX9 is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, especially for a novice
Reviews.Author: GEA
Reviews.Content: This has been an outsanding camera for us. It has plenty of options to select for more control, but it allows for easy use and fast picture taking. Reviews.Title: Pretty good phone
Reviews.Author: Patrick A. Ritter
Reviews.Content: First, this thing takes really good photos for such a small, convenient point-and-shoot camera. That's why it gets four stars. Well that, and it checks out ok on the big-ticket items (e.g. it's durable, looks nice, battery life is long, etc.).It loses a star because the menu system is pretty bad. It's annoying to change any photo settings, so you'll probably end up just finding one decent all-around setting and going with that. Also, the camera is really kind of TOO small. I'm a pretty coordinated guy with small girly hands, but I fumble this thing around quite a bit and have dropped it a time or three. If you're clumsy or you're working with cold fingers on a chilly day, good luck!

Reviews.Title: Sony DSCWX9/BBDL 16.2 MP CMOS Sensor with 5 x Optical Zoom Digital Camera Bundle Black
Reviews.Author: Luis J. Gomez Navarro
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, offers very good resolution, the pictures show vivid colors, panoramic shots are excellent and prosesan faster, 3D shots are very good. The videos are excellent and the audio too.The camera offers settings for different shots in different scenarios. The photographs in dark places do very well. Cons: The digital zoom is good but must improve to take pictures over long distances. The battery lasts a very short but this is solved by buying another battery. Conclusion: Excellent camera, very fast and very good for taking photographs is a pocket camera. Excellent seller, the purchase was made ​​without any problem.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera - Hate the quirks
Reviews.Author: Matthew Magnone
Reviews.Content: After owning this camera for almost a year, I am sadly getting rid of this camera because it is just not reliable enough. Battery life when taking video lately has been crapping out on me in the first few minutes on a new fully charged battery, even my backup batteries doing the same thing. Also while taking video this camera has randomly shut off on me causing me to lose part of the video. As a YouTuber, I can't afford for this to happen! Im not sure what is up with the "preparing image database" thing when inserting a new SD card but it takes forever, and is annoying, and sometimes it doesn't prepare it correctly causing errors, and forcing you to reformat the SD card in your computer. I loved this camera since it shot full HD video and the nice photo features and great quality, it is just unreliable, which I can't afford to have. I got a Canon point and shoot and so far so good, its fast, no "preparing image database crap" and the colors the camera produces are fantastic!This camera had so much potential but sadly didn't live up to it with my experiences with it.

Reviews.Title: Good one!
Reviews.Author: Apps
Reviews.Content: Very handy camera. Battery life is good. I am not a great photographer but picture quality is well above my expectations. Easy to use. lots of modes.Scratchy sound while zooming and un-zooming the lens.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Christine Frieberg
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my Sony Cyber-Shot DSC T100 decided to die on me.  After extensive research, I finally selected this camera and I am happy with my decision.  The picture quality is incredible and there are a lot of features, that even after owning this for a year, I have yet to really utilize. One really cool setting is the panoramic setting - the outcome is incredible!  Another one is the available scene selections - there are 14 to choose from and they really do aid in taking fantastic pictures.  The menu is easy to navigate through and the screen is large and bright. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Wow, AMAZING video and great low light!!
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: My wife returned something she got from Best Buy this year and got this little camera instead. I wasn't expecting much out of it given the price tag but I've been very surprised. Photos on this camera are very good. I don't buy into the quality being measured by the megapixel count. Most cameras just interpolate across more pixels then they need to so you just end up with a crappy huge picture. This camera produces very nice stills and was very good in low light.The thing that amazed me with this camera was the quality of the video. I have a new Samsung 46" LED TV and I hooked this camera into it directly via HDMI and the resolution and color were better than most Blu Ray feature films. A couple years prior, I had purchased a sony HD camcorder and I'm sad to say that this camera's video quality puts that one to shame. Last week I shot some video on the renouned Canon 2Ti and the video from this camera was just as impressive.I was pretty amazed by this camera, I used to be in the video production industry and this camera blows away what a studio 10 years ago would pay upwards around 50K to own.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: bigstudio
Reviews.Content: This was very good service, the camera arrived sooner than expected, along with several extras-I couldn't be more pleased, excellent!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Book Carpenter
Reviews.Content: The main reasons I got this camera were for the panorama function and its good movie quality. I also like the size because I wanted something I could carry with me when I didn't want to carry a DSLR. This Sony is small, light, and very easy to use. There is no lag when I push the shutter button. The still pictures are excellent quality, as is the video. There are lots of options available through the Menu or the round dial on the back.I haven't tried to run down the battery, but battery life has not been a problem. I can go out and take pictures all day - like 200 or more - and there is still plenty of battery power left. I bought a separate charger, along with a couple of generic batteries, just in case. I wish it had a viewfinder, but they are no loger available on most P&S; cameras.Overall, I am completely satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: NICE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JorgEstuardo
Reviews.Content: This camera works good, but It has a high consumption of battery or the battery does not work very well, the delivery time was very good and the picture quality is very good

Reviews.Title: more than good
Reviews.Author: Salome Lugo
Reviews.Content: it is so good, the pictures are so good, besides the options are wonderful, the 3d thing and the panoramic are awesome.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot SDCWX9 16.2 MP
Reviews.Author: Photogirl
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this camera.  I bought it so I'd have an easy camera to take along and not have to lug around my big camera.  I am pleased with it so far.  I'd have to say it's a waste to have 16.2 MP, you don't really need that many even if you do blow up your pictures.  The quality of the videos are good, although the sound is not the best.  It does not take the place of an actual camcorder, but to have for the spur of the moment, it does the job.

Reviews.Title: Owned 2 hours and failed to retract
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: I've owned this Camera for 2 hours and the lens failed to retract.  I have another Sony camera, which has been going strong for years.  For the first 15 pictures I took, they looked flawless.  I love the simplicity of Sony's interface.  I would love to give this camera a positive review, but when it has an obvious manufacturer defect..... within 2 HOURS....

Reviews.Title: Love it - works great

Reviews.Content: I'm enjoying the new camera a lot.  It works great and the images are crystal clear - which is mainly why I bought the camera - for more megapixels.  I don't find the Sony website/download program for pictures particularly user friendly . . .  but that doesn't particularly have anything to do with the camera. . . . which I love!

Reviews.Author: Jasher
Reviews.Content: I have had two of these cameras and both broke within a couple of months.  With the first camera after a couple days of heavy use the lens would not retract.  I returned and got a replacement within a couple days.  The replacement camera worked great for a few weeks and took great pictures.  Then after a few weeks of the camera not being used I go to use it and the internal LCD screen was cracked.  It was never dropped or mishandled, just sat on a shelf for a couple weeks in between uses.  This is the last Sony camera I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
